_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Elkhart Cooperative Equity Exchange is an agricultual retail business which specializes in grain storage for are producers as well as the sale of agricultural inputs for crop enhancement. The company strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place. Our owners, managers and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.



The worst case and the alternate release scenarios have been evaluated and shared with our Local First Responders as part of an on-going training program. More inportantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.



The Elkhart Cooperative Equity Exchange maintains and operates their anhydrous ammonia plant in strict accordance with all State and Local authorities. The Colorado Department of Ag inspects our plant on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement. Changes or improvements in the facility's equipment will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency's request, or as found to be necessary by our maintenance staff.



Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, plant maintenance and the employees are competency tested over the training material. Each employee uses goggles and gloves during ammonia poerations as well as always providing plenty of emergency safety water during nurse tank loading operations.



Our Emergency Action Plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public and the area First Responders. The Elkhart Cooperative Equity Exchange provides plant tours for our local fire department and our action plan has been shared with the County Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC). Each of our resonding agencies is aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us in
the event of an emergency or accidental release.
